answers.answer: My first test came out 5 points above normal, my 2nd test ( the 3 hours one) showed everything is just fine and I don't have  gestational diabetes.  My mistake was to eat normal breakfast before my 1st test (although the nurse told me so) and that's why it was a bit high. Just remember not to eat or drink anything for 12 hours before your 2nd test and you will be fine. And take a book or something with you, 3 hours feel really long just sitting there. Good luck!

I did my GD test. My fast was positive but during the 2nd and 3rd blood draws I passed. My Obgyn sent me to a diabetes clinic. I test 4 times a day. Because my wake up blood glucose I have to take insulin at night. They follow up before the decide. Don't worry about it.

If you are worried a few issues GD can do is cause your babies tummy to get to large. Causes the baby to have issues coming out of the birth canal. Also the baby when the cord is cut to have issues because they have too much insulin.
I'm a point below and they're making me do the 3 hour test just in case. Ugh!
I'm be taking my test around 26 weeks. I really don't want to though but because I'm carrying twins the doctor has already ordered it to be done automatically.

I test 4 times a day and do 2 types of insulin twice a day. I've never had it either with my other kids. Baby can be large and at birth can be jaundice and when the cord is cut baby blood sugar can drop dramatically so they give baby an iv to regulate blood sugars. High risk for adolescent diabetes for baby. But everything can be managed with diet and if needed medications or insulin. Hang in there, plenty of us moms have it you are not alone

question: I took my gd test last week and was one point above normal so I have to go back Wednesday for the tolerance test. I am nervous because I never had gt before and this is number 4 for me. What did you have to change?? How was the baby after delivery? Kinda worried!!!
title: has anyone taken their gestational diabetes test and came out positive?
